revised_title: Surface Science and Catalysis: Advances in Understanding Metal Catalyst Systems
tldr: This article discusses the advancements in understanding metal catalyst systems through the integration of surface science and catalysis. It identifies three classes of catalytic reactions and presents case histories for each class. The article highlights the importance of high coordination sites on atomically rough surfaces for high reactivity and introduces a theory that correlates increased charge fluctuations at these sites with enhanced catalytic activity.
